Smoked Trout-Avocado Dip Recipe | Bon Appétit

While smoked trout is great in this dip, any canned fish (think sardines, mackerel, or tuna) will work—just make sure it's packed in oil. Crackers optional. All products featured on Bon Appétit are independently selected by our editors. However, when you buy something through the retail links below, we earn an affiliate commission.What you’ll needChevronChevronMeasuring Spoons$10 At Bon Appétit MarketMedium Bowl$17 At AmazonForkChef's Knife$34.53 At AmazonCutting Board$10 At IKEAMicroplane$16 At AmazonSpoon$24.69 At AmazonSmall Bowl$13 At AmazonIngredients2 servings23-oz. tins smoked trout2scallions1lemon1Tbsp. mayonnaise1tsp. kosher salt, divided½medium ripe avocadoFreshly ground black pepperCrackers (for serving)PreparationStep 1Pour off excess oil from 2 trout tins, then place trout in a medium bowl.Step 2Thinly slice 2 scallions on a diagonal. Add half to bowl with trout; reserve remaining scallions for serving.Step 3Using a microplane, finely grate half of lemon into bowl with trout.Step 4Cut lemon into quarters and remove any seeds. Squeeze 2 quarters over trout mixture.Step 5Add 1 Tbsp. mayonnaise and ½ tsp. salt and toss gently to combine.Step 6Finely chop ½ avocado. Transfer to a small bowl. Squeeze juice from remaining 2 lemon quarters over. Season with remaining ½ tsp. salt.Step 7Top dip with avocado and a few grinds of pepper. Serve with crackers alongside.How would you rate Smoked Trout-Avocado Dip?Leave a ReviewTell us what you thinkReviews (3)Back to TopTriangleI made this using home made canned smoked pike. It was delicious. I didn't need to add any salt because the smoked fish was already pretty salty. I did add a couple of cloves of chopped garlic. I think some fresh herbs would be good in season.
